intro: Traxilum, commonly known as the silverleaf fern, is a unique plant with a distinctive botanical structure. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, silver-hued fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forests or rocky crevices. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it to the substrate while absorbing nutrients. Traxilum reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia on the undersides of its leaves.
